intro: Semecarpus merrillianus, commonly known as the Indian chestnut or horse chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces large, spiny fruits that contain a single, hard-shelled seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. However, it is important to note that its seeds and other parts can be toxic if ingested.
